issue.title: C++: Upload gcov coverage data to coveralls.io
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-27](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-27). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I recently did this for Parquet (https://github.com/apache/parquet-cpp/commit/9cab887f2337ae6205cbd7ea908bcb749c5c9343); it will be nice to have the coverage report available to assist with unit testing.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-27?focusedCommentId=16210457) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Having C++ coverage reports is long overdue. `[~pcmoritz]` `[~xhochy]` `[~cpcloud]` anyone up to do this? The biggest thing will be dealing with the exclusions when uploading to coveralls. We already have this set up for parquet-cpp but I haven't checked the report in a while to see if it looks reasonable (sometimes a portion of the STL is picked up)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-27?focusedCommentId=16336856) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It would be nice to be able to look at C++ code coverage. If someone can investigate this further it would be a big help

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-27?focusedCommentId=16535350) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
`[~pitrou]` has set up code coverage with codecov.io, so we won't pursue coveralls further
